page.title: 11COMPTON CHURCH
page.content: The church of{St.Nicholas at Compton is over 1000 years old. The tower, nave and part of the chancel were built by the{Saxons}before the Norman conquest, as was the small square window probably belonging to a hermit's cell.The{Normans}raised the height of the walls with pillars and arches and built a vaulted roof to the Sanctuary. The upper Sanctuary is the only one in England and has wooden rails over 800 years old.The East window has 12th century stained glass showing Mary and Jesus.There are murals in a step pattern and on the chancel arch is a graffiti picture of a Knight believed to be a Crusader in the 12th century. The church has a spire. On the south wall is a scratch dial where shadows from a wooden peg showed the times for services.
